holidays.name: Make Up Your Own Holiday Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to the joy of inventing your very own holiday and celebrating it however you like! Whether it's 'Talk Like a Pirate' Day or 'Eat Ice Cream for Breakfast' Day, today‚Äôs your chance to be a holiday creator.
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday emerged from the quirky spirit of holiday enthusiasts who wanted a day to unleash their creativity and fun without limits.
holidays.funFact: You can actually register your invented holiday online and see if it catches on with the world!

holidays.name: Spinach Day
holidays.description: A day to honor the humble spinach leaf ‚Äì overloaded with nutrients and the secret weapon of cartoon sailor Popeye! Perfect excuse to eat a big bowl of spinach whether raw, steamed, or in a smoothie.
holidays.origin: Observed mostly in the United States, this day celebrates the superfood qualities of spinach and encourages people to eat healthier greens.
holidays.funFact: Spinach is packed with iron, but it was once mistakenly thought to have ten times more than it actually does due to a decimal point error!

holidays.name: Teacher's Day (Czech Republic and Slovakia)
holidays.description: A day celebrating the vital role teachers play in education and society, commemorating John Amos Comenius, the father of modern education.
holidays.origin: March 26 marks the birthday of John Amos Comenius (1592), a Czech philosopher and educator who introduced creative teaching methods and universal education.
holidays.funFact: Comenius invented the picture book method for teaching children, long before modern textbooks existed.

holidays.name: Purple Day for Epilepsy Awareness
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about epilepsy and to support those affected by this often misunderstood neurological disorder by wearing purple and sharing information.
holidays.origin: Purple Day was started by a young Canadian girl named Cassidy Megan in 2008 to bring attention and acceptance to people living with epilepsy.
holidays.funFact: Wearing purple on March 26 supports epilepsy awareness worldwide ‚Äî purple is associated with 'calm' and 'healing' in many cultures.
